titleStmt.title: William McCow v. Washington Territory. Original Verdict

bibl.title: William McCow v. Territory of Washington. Final Veridict.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla | ss
div1.p: In Justices Court before O.P. Lacy Justice of the Peace
To any Constable and the Keeper of The Jail of said County

Whereas William McCow of Walla Walla Washington Territory has been brought this day before the undersigned one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County charged on oath of P. Bently with having on the 19th day of November 1876, in said County committed the offense of assault with intent to murder the said P. Bentley and it appearing to the said Justice that the said William McCow has been guilty of assulat with intent to kill and murder committed at the time and place aforesaid and whereas the said William McCow has failed to give bond in the sum of one thousand dollars for his appearance to answer at the next term of the District Court as required by me.

Therefore you the said Constable as commanded in the name of the United States further to convey and deliever the said William McCow to the said Keeper and hereby commanded to recieve the said William McCow into your custody in said Jail and him there safley keep until he be discharged by due cause of law.
Given under my hand this 20th day of November 1876
div1.ab: O.P. Lacy Justice of the Peace
